meanings.definition: A type of glass that is made in large, flat sheets.
meanings.sent1: The plateglass in the window was so clear, it felt like there was no glass at all.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers carefully installed the plateglass to create a modern look for the building.
meanings.sent3: When the bird flew into the plateglass window, it comically bounced off and flew away unharmed.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes reflected in the plateglass, showing a glimpse of her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The plateglass shimmered in the sunlight, creating a dazzling display of colors.

meanings.definition: A large sheet of glass used in windows, doors, and other architectural applications.
meanings.sent1: The plateglass on the storefront was so clean, you could see your reflection clearly.
meanings.sent2: The plateglass shattered into a thousand pieces when the ball hit it with force.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the plateglass disappear and reappear to the amazement of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The plateglass acted as a barrier between the noisy street and the peaceful library.
meanings.sent5: The plateglass framed the beautiful garden outside, bringing nature indoors.
